item.title: [Function]FindNPC
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

will u ever tell me how to fix it?..

this is wat i got

program New; {.include SRL/SRL.scar} Function FindNPC(var NPCx, NPCy : integer; Colors: Array Of integer; NPCName : string): boolean; var i : integer; begin MouseSpeed := 8; for i := 0 to GetArrayLength(Colors)-1 do begin if (FindColorSpiralTolerance(NPCx, NPCy, Colors[i], MSX1, MSY1, MSX2, MSY2, 30)) then begin Mmouse(NPCx, NPCy, 0, 0); Wait(10); if (IsUpText(NPCName)) then begin Result := True; Break; end; end; end; MouseSpeed := DefaultMS; end; begin setupsrl; if(FindNPC(x,y,[00000],'cat'))then writeln('npc found') end.

see how its in line 20…

Read full topic

item.title: [Function]FindNPC
item.dc:creator: @WhiteShadow WhiteShadow
item.description:
@WhiteShadow wrote:

GetArrayLength(Colors) - 1

Don’t forget to do minus one. For example array length is 3, that’s 0, 1, 2. Then you don’t do 0 - 3, then that’s 4. So you minus one so it’s 0, 1, 2. Get me? Yeah

Well, this is sexy, love it k_thx

:DD

Read full topic

item.title: [Function]FindNPC
item.dc:creator: @Avaphi Avaphi
item.description:
@Avaphi wrote:

Here is a function I chopped up. It finds an NPC.

Function FindNPC(var NPCx, NPCy : integer; Colors: Array Of integer; NPCName : string): boolean; var i : integer; begin MouseSpeed := 8; for i := 0 to GetArrayLength(Colors)-1 do begin if (FindColorSpiralTolerance(NPCx, NPCy, Colors[i], MSX1, MSY1, MSX2, MSY2, 30)) then begin Mmouse(NPCx, NPCy, 0, 0); Wait(10); if (IsUpText(NPCName)) then begin Result := True; Break; end; end; end; MouseSpeed := DefaultMS; end;

Usage:

if (FindNPC(x, y, [Color1, Color2, Color3] 'Man')) then
begin
  doblah;
end;

Noob Note: Inside of the Square brackets in my example([Color1, Color2, Color3]) you should realize that you can put as many or as little colors as you want : Example 1: [Color1] OR Example 2: [Color1, Color2, Color3, Color4, Color5].

Final note: Hope it helps people out

Read full topic
